entry.title: Swim in the refreshing river
entry.content:
Werdinsel, a hidden, cozy spot is a little island between the Limmat and a smaller river.
You can swim in the river under the shade of big trees and feel miles away from the city.
Flussbad Au-Höngg can be reached by the bus 80 and 89 to Höhenklingensteig or
by Tram 13 to Wartau

entry.title: A bit of history
entry.content:
When you stroll down the Neumarkt, which is one of the prettiest street in the Old Town, make sure
to stop by the CITY ARCHIVES on Neumarkt 4. Inside the remarkable Haus zum Rechberg you will find
a historical exhibition and a scale model of the historical city. As you will notice in 1800 Zurich was
surrounded by a town wall, part of the original wall can still be seen inside the excellent Restaurant
Kantorei just next door. The fountain in front of the Kantorei dates back to the 15th century and was
originally called Nike fountain. It was rebuilt in 1987 and today is called Jupiterbrunnen.
Opening hours (free entrance) of the archives: Monday through Friday 8.00am till 6.00pm and
Saturday 10am till 4.00pm

entry.title: Manifesta 11,European Biennal for Contemporary Art
entry.content:
Manifesta, brings the visual arts together with the urban, social, historical, economical, ecological and architectural context.

Manifesta 11, with its theme “What People Do for Money: Some Joint Ventures”, focuses attention on the relation between artistic work and labour. In our post-industrial age, it is a concept that resonates acutely with life not only in Zurich but in the rest of the world.

Various location throughout the city: 11.6.–18.9.2016

entry.title: Gardens of the world
entry.content:
Gardens tell stories - stories of a yearning for paradise, stories of love, retreat, power and beauty. Museum Rietberg invites you to take a stroll through the world of gardens from Japan to England.

Located in the beautiful and historic park - the Rieterpark - the museum itself will form part of a unique exhibition for garden-lovers.

http://www.rietberg.ch/de-ch/home.aspx

entry.title: bikes to borrow for free
entry.content:
Zurich is a great place to cycle around, and all you need to do is stop by Züri Rollt Free Bike Rental, grab yourself a pair of wheels and go explore the city or bike along the lake.

In order to loan a bike from Züri Rollt Free Bike Rental, they require you leave some kind of ID, plus a small deposit in case you cause any damage to the bike. (you will even find bikes with kids seats, children’s bikes and at a charge of CHF 20.00 electric bikes, check the locations on where they have these special bikes available)

There are several spots in the city where you can find a Züri Rollt Free Bike Rental depot, including near the train station on Museumstrasse, at the Bahnhofstrasse Globus store, at Bellvue or at Bürkliplatz

https://www.stadt-zuerich.ch/aoz/de/index/shop/veloverleih/unsere-flotte.html#contenttabs

entry.title: Zurich's biggest photography art walk
entry.content:
A centre stage for photographers! In an industrial-looking building, on the main floor, you will always find a carefully curated photo exhibition of a well know photographer (where the photographs can be purchased) but just as interesting is the 3rd floor where the PHOTOBASTEI rents at a reasonable price exhibition space to local photographers in order for them to have an opportunity to show their work.

Also worth mentioning is the cool bar and café where they often feature live music and last but not least the cute French bulldog Bubu who always circles amongst the visitors.

www.photobastei.ch - Sihlquai 125
  • Tue/Wed 12.00 - 9.00pm,
  • Thur/Fri/Sat 12.00am - 12.00pm,
  • Sund 12.00 am - 6.00pm
